Package de.oth.blocklib.world.chunks

Class ChunkStorage

java.lang.Object
de.oth.blocklib.world.chunks.ChunkStorage
Direct Known Subclasses:
ClientChunkStorage, ServerChunkStorage, SinglePlayerChunkStorage
public abstract class ChunkStorage
extends java.lang.Object
The ChunkStorage holds and manages all Chunks that are currently needed in any way. These Chunks are divided into 4 Categories and are saved in 4 different HashMaps The ChunkStorage should be the only class that actually creates Chunks. Every other instance that needs Chunks can request them from the ChunkStorage and from then on access the Chunk with getChunk. IMPORTANT! As soon as the Chunk is not needed anymore it has to be returned the the ChunkStorage.
Author:
Tobias Mueller, Stefan Hofweber (WiSe 2017/18), Raphael Neudert (Coronasemester SoSe 2020) accountable for multiplayer functions

  • Method Details

    • update

      public void update()
      needs to be called frequently (for example once per frame), so all chunks that finished loading can be fetched and chunks that changed can be updated

    • getFinishedChunks

      protected abstract boolean getFinishedChunks()
      Checks if some Chunks in currentlyLoadingChunks are finished and puts them into loadedChunks
      The amount of chunks with mesh that can be finished (con without loosing performance in the rest of the game is limited.
      Returns:
      returns true, if some chunks have finished loading in this frame

    • getFinishedMeshedChunks

      private boolean getFinishedMeshedChunks()

    • updateChangedChunkMeshes

      private void updateChangedChunkMeshes()
      Checks if any ChunkMesh in the chunkArray needs to be updated Chunks without mesh do not need to be updated

    • sortChunksByCameraDistance

      private void sortChunksByCameraDistance​(java.util.List<Chunk> finishedChunks)

    • areNeighborsLoaded

      public boolean areNeighborsLoaded​(ChunkIDObject cid)
      Returns whether neighbor chunks are loaded. These chunks do not need to be meshed. Non-loaded or still loading chunks are not considered in this case.
      Parameters:
      cid - The chunk ID around which the neighbors are checked
      Returns:
      True if all neighbors are loaded, false otherwise

    • areNeighborsNotLoading

      protected boolean areNeighborsNotLoading​(Chunk chunk)
      Returns whether all relevant neighbor chunks are loaded or not loading at all. Only chunks in the ChunkManager.chunkArray are considered
      Parameters:
      chunk - The chunk whose neighbors are looked at

    • meshChunk

      protected void meshChunk​(Chunk chunk)
      Used to create the mesh of a given chunk either single or multithreaded

    • requestChunk

      public abstract void requestChunk​(ChunkIDObject id, java.lang.Object owner)
      This method is currently used to generate a missing chunk near a player IMPORTANT!: When the method is called, call returnChunk once the chunk isnt needed anymore
      Parameters:
      id - the ChunkIDObject for the Chunk that is requested
      owner - the Object that needs the chunk

    • requestChunkWithoutMesh

      public abstract void requestChunkWithoutMesh​(ChunkIDObject id, java.lang.Object owner)
      IMPORTANT!: When the method is called, call returnChunk once the chunk isnt needed anymore doesnt create a mesh for the requested chunk
      Parameters:
      id - the ChunkIDObject for the chunk that is requested
      owner - the Object that needs the chunk

    • getChunkWithMesh

      public Chunk getChunkWithMesh​(ChunkIDObject id)
      returns the chunk only if its loaded with mesh
      Parameters:
      id - the ChunkIDObject of the wanted Chunk
      Returns:
      Chunk c if loaded, else null

    • getChunk

      public Chunk getChunk​(Vector3i pos)

    • getChunk

      public abstract Chunk getChunk​(ChunkIDObject id)
      returns the Chunk, if its loaded. with, or without mesh
      Parameters:
      id - the ChunkIDObject of the wanted Chunk
      Returns:
      Chunk c if the chunk is loaded with or without mesh, else null

      public Chunk getChunk​(org.lwjgl.util.vector.Vector3f pos)

    • returnChunk

      public abstract void returnChunk​(ChunkIDObject id, java.lang.Object owner)
      HAS TO BE CALLED once the requested chunk is no longer needed
      Parameters:
      id - the ChunkIDObject of the chunk that should be returned
      owner - the object that needs the chunk
